meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a snake.
meanings.sent1: The colubrine pattern on the fabric looked like a winding snake.
meanings.sent2: The garden hose had a colubrine shape as it slithered across the lawn.
meanings.sent3: The colubrine design on the cake made it look like a playful serpent.
meanings.sent4: Her colubrine movements on the dance floor were mesmerizing, like a graceful snake.
meanings.sent5: The colubrine markings on the butterfly's wings were vibrant and eye-catching.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the Colubridae family of snakes.
meanings.sent1: The colubrine scales of the snake shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The zoo had a special exhibit featuring colubrine species from the Colubridae family.
meanings.sent3: The colubrine exhibit at the museum was both educational and fascinating.
meanings.sent4: Herpetologists study the colubrine characteristics of various snake species.
meanings.sent5: The colubrine behavior of the snakes in the documentary was captivating to watch.
